content.description:
Moving from left to right:

There are four connected line segments and a semicircle that is connected to the last line segment.

The first line segment begins at point (negative 3 comma 2) and ends at point (negative 2 comma 2).

The second line segment begins at point (negative 2 comma 2) and ends at point (negative 1 comma 0).

The third line segment begins at point (negative 1 comma 0) and ends at point (0 comma 1).

The fourth line segment begins at point (0 comma 1) and ends at point (1 comma negative 1).

The semicircle of radius 1 begins at point (1 comma negative 1), passes through point (2 comma negative 2), and ends at point (3 comma negative 1).

The graph of <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x close parentheses"> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> </mrow> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math>, consisting of four line segments and a semicircle, is shown for <math alttext="negative 3 less or equal than x less or equal than 3"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.
content.question: Which of the following is the transformed graph for <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x plus 1 close parentheses minus 2"> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>-</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math> ?
